description: Articles in this series examine shell companies masking real estate deals.
title: Towers of Secrecy: Piercing the Shell Companies
title_page: Towers of Secrecy: Piercing the Shell Companies - The New York Times
text: This investigation inspired the Treasury Department to begin identifying and tracking secret buyers of high-end properties, starting in Manhattan and Miami-Dade County and it helped the Treasury get momentum to complete a rule requiring banks to identify clients who open accounts using shell companies. New York City had also responded by creating a new transparency rule for L.L.C. buyers. Federal lawmakers introduced legislation to require transparency into shell companies. And the US DOJ filed an asset forfeiture case seeking $1 billion in assets from people close to the primer minister of Malaysia, who were the focus of one of the Times's articles.
